This place reminds of my college days at the University of Arizona in Tucson: cowboy hats, country music and lots of Jack Daniels bottles used as decoration. There was live music and the main singer looked like a skinnier Toby Keith. The restaurant was loud and our waitresses handled our large (and mostly obnoxious, though in good fun) party very well.

As for the food, I ordered the "hottie wrap" which is a sun dried tomato tortilla filled with strips of fried chicken (I know, not part of my usual diet but with all the Jack Daniels decorations around I felt fried anything was appropriate somehow) and lots of veggies. My guilty conscience made me ask for fat free ranch instead of bleu cheese. The wrap tasted fresh and everyone enjoyed their food. Orders ranged from burgers, to wings, to mac & cheese.

I'm not going to lie, our party of 20 people had an awesome time. Everything was on the house so needless to say the drinks were flowing. I didn't partake in any of the speciality cocktails because they all come in giant mason jars. I wanted something a little daintier. Oh, and to make things interesting some man (in hindsight I pray it was the bartender) came around with a bottle and gave everyone in our party (guys and girls) shots. The atmosphere was very fun and it was a great birthday dinner setting for a loud group.

Pretty good place. Just decided to eat here because we were staying at Harrah's and it was convenient. I was pleasantly surprised. Food took a little long to come out but once it did it was great. A little on the pricey side but that's expected because of the location. I think I paid $17 for a grilled chicken sandwich and fries.

the service to just get a table....horrible.  Host?  hardly lives up to that name.  She said go find a table in bar.  None available.  We did a round.  And another.  She didn't help.  I get busy on game day but no seats for empty tables.  She said there were chairs but we didn't find any -- maybe she meant we need to make or bring our own chair.

We ended up leaving...disappointed we couldn't grab a bite but happy that we left before they also told us to make our own food.
Cool place, great country music and the BEST FRIES EVER!!!! You have to order the French fries. They're sooooo good.

Not a location I would have chosen--I was invited to join someone who was already coming here. Pulled pork sandwich was OK. Was served a mason jar full of diet Pepsi ... only problem: I ordered a diet Coke and wasn't told I'd be served Pepsi. An awful surprise.

Served a basket of bread and baby corn muffins (oh! the humanity!) with something that clearly wasn't butter. 

Cheaper than many places on the strip. Also, they allowed us to park for a few hours (we watched the Belgium vs. US game) without a hassle. Lots of TVs ...

With some great reviews and some "not to great" ones, we thought we would give it a try since we were staying at Harrah's anyway.  Since some of our experience was great and some not so much, I have decided on 3-1/2 stars.  The visit didn't start off so well.  We were told that we would have about a 10 minute wait.  No big deal at all, we just went next door to the gift shop. We were literally there for 5-6 minutes and made the 5 second trek back to the restaurant.  The  hostess informed us that she had called our name and had to give our table away and that we would have to go back on the "list".  Again, no problem, since it was later in the evening and it didn't seem busy in the slightest.  

At this point I would like to insert my opinion on the Hostess.  I truly believe that this person had something against smiling.  You would think that the business owner would want the first person that customers would come in to contact with would be a friendly, helpful person who appears to enjoy what they do.  To represent the brand in a positive way.  I expected a lot better, Toby!  

When we were led to our table, it was a little surprising that the place was less than half full.  As I mentioned, it was later in the evening but the Hostess made it seem as though it was packed!  Anyway, the food was a highlight, and since this is a restaurant, I guess that is what was most important!  We had the Brisket Nachos.  They were amazing!  My boys both had Bronco Burgers and they were HUGE!  They both loved them.  I had the Texas Cheesesteak.  It was good but not great in my opinion.  It was pretty soggy, but tasted pretty good.  

I would go back, if only for those Nachos!  I am sure that the atmosphere is much better around dinner time.  It was pretty laid back at the time we went.  Hopefully the Hostess was just having a bad day.
Free food and beer for military! Yup 5 starts. Great bartender and TVs everywhere. Foods also pretty damn good. Try the deviled eggs! The burgers are damn good!

I had eaten here once a while back and enjoyed it a lot. Yelpers Bobby K. and Anna from VA came into town and suggested this place for dinner. It's located inside Harrah's and coming in from the parking garage it's going to be hard to miss since it's right there on the left and country music can be heard coming from inside the restaurant. Bobby had seats for us already so there was no wait time. Our server was friendly and took great care of us. They have TVs all over playing music videos and while most of it was obviously country music, they did play some Metallica and Pearl Jam LOL. Our table was lost in awesome conversation until we noticed my wife stuck on one of the TVs. They played 3 Luke Bryan videos back to back so we lost her for a bit. They have a bar you can sit at if you don't want to sit at a table or booth.

I had a Fried Mac and Cheese ball that was average. I was craving a burger so I looked over the menu to see what sounded good. I went with the Hottie Burger. The burger came with a hot link on it as well fried onions, lettuce, tomato and pepper jack cheese. The burger was cooked to my liking and tasted really good. The only complaint is that it was spicy at all. Not even a hint of heat. For a burger with a name "Hottie" in it you'd expect it to have a kick. While the burger was very good.... I would suggest they add some fried jalapenos in place of the fried onions. My wife had the Hottie Wrap and felt the same way. She said it tasted great and the amount of guacamole and other stuff inside her wrap was great but the chicken had no heat at all. The Fried Bologna sandwich yelper Anna got was effing interesting. I left stuffed. That's all.

This is a bit off the beaten path. You have to make your way through Harrah's all the way to the back, up the escalator and then there it is.

So for some reason I have been here a few times, and each time I really thought the food was less than desirable. This time was a little different. 

The food is quite pricey for what it is. Yeah, you get a dollar off if you use your Total Rewards card, but really - it's still kind of expensive for just ok food. I got the chicken wrap last time and it was utterly inedible. I definitely won't get that ever again. Lots of wrap, not a lot of chicken.

This time, we ordered the fried macaroni and cheese and the brisket nachos. Let me say, I was pleasantly surprised. The mac and cheese balls were lightly battered and fried just crispy enough. The nachos - were heaping and the brisket was very good. good choices this time.

Next - the beer - so there isn't a great selection of draft beer - but the bonus is how large a draft beer is. I believe they are 22oz for $10. Which isn't bad. And of course you can take it to go in a plastic cup. (But don't try and bring your outside drink into TK's)

If you're with a lot of friends, a beer tower is definitely the way to go... 

Minuses - the whole bar area didn't have a server. So all the tables in the bar area hadn't been bussed and it was a total mess. It's not really a problem to order the food through the bar,  but just means getting up and down if you need other things. The bartender was friendly and helpful, but then you wonder what you're tipping for when you are getting up and down... but oh well.

Had a great time here. Our waiter was awesome and the burgers were tastey. The music was also definitely good too. All in all a great place to eat. And they have a special for military that you just can't beat.

I love country music and good food, so as suggested a friend of mine tagged along with me and we went to check this place out. It is located on the second floor of the Harrah's Casino. First impression of this place was wow, nice low key, laid back place. The food smelled really good and my stomach was ready ;) We were seated near the bar area and once in a while during dinner you'd hear whistles going off and a showdown going on at the bar...a lively place for sure. Country music filled the place and TV monitors showed the latest music videos on CMT. The second thing i noticed about this place was some of the male waiters were hot. :P A big plus for me.

I started off with a drink, and I was surprised that my drink was going to cost $15!!!!! I understood when i received my Toad sucker Pond in a huge MASON JAR! These people take their booze very seriously...it was great! When my Burger and onion rings came out to the table i was amazed to find the onion rings stacked ON TOP of my burger rather than the traditional on-the side placing. The food was exceptionally good, but the price was a bit high. 

Still, I will definitely be coming here again...even if the prices are a bit high!!!

This place was a VERY LAST RESORT! I will not ever recommend this place to anyone. The food was mediocre at best. I had a sampler and the BBQ that was on the plate was so gross and overly greasy. The service was very poor and took forever. My friend ordered a chicken fried steak and he said it was so disgusting. He didn't have any gravy on his mashed potatoes and the steak was poorly prepared. I just won't ever go back to this place. If your hungry then go somewhere else!! This place is terrible!

An interesting place to start a day off at.

We got up late (I know, in vegas?  really?) and were super hungry, so we ambled down the strip, and an idea for a fried bolonga sandwich came to mind, so we went over and sat down.

The service was decent.  The fried bologna with freedom fries was good, the fried mac and cheese was artery hardening.

Overall a decent meal, waaay better then most of the Coffee shops in the hotels i have eaten at, but nothing spectacular.
Drinks are good and I love the decor and country music, but the food is just OK. Double check the menu because couple of items are named the same thing, already messed up my order!

Amazing Bar Food!!! 
Mac and Cheese Balls and Fried Bologna Sandwich! PERIOD!! Don't come here with HIGH class taste buds! Excellent Bar Food but after reading some people's reviews I don't think they know what the specialty items on the menu are. 

The environment is always fun. Great servers and bartenders! We ate at the bar one time and at a table another time and came last year for a friends B-day party with a group of about 20 people and everyone had a great time!

We ordered too much or rather Toby's serves large portions! 

We split between us the Fried Pickles, the Rueben (which included fries) with a side of season veggies. Our drink was Kentucky Sweet Honey - Loved It!

Everything was delicious but we couldn't finish the fries and we were full the rest of the day!

I happened to see the happy hour sign as I was leaving the monorail and heading to another location. Originally, I wasn't going to stop but I saw the special pricing and decided to stop in. Several hours later, I had a nice buzz and my bank account hadn't taken a massive hit like other Vegas establishments did. I'm not normally a big Blue Moon drinker but $4.50 for 2 mason jar (32oz) drinks was a deal I don't think I could find anywhere else. 
I think a lot of others thought the same thing and as a result there was one bartender running around trying to service the whole place. The service took longer than average and I had to ask where my appetizer was since it had taken so long. 

Overall, I did enjoy my experience but I think they could benefit by having a bit more coverage in the bar area.

Toby Keith I do NOT love your bar. The food was ok. But the staff was RUDE!!! my goodness! Unfriendly! It was our first time there. My husband & I were meeting our family there. We were the first to arrive. After standing in the front for over 5 min. I walk to a podium off to the side & ask if we seat ourselves or is there a host? I was rudely informed by a crabby phillipino lady that she WAS the host. And we could not be seated until our entire party arrived. So we waited. When we all got there & got seated...we waited some more. The whole experience was way overpriced. Thumbs down Toby Keith.....get a new staff.
Don't bother.  Understaffed and burgers are way better at Guy Fieri's in the Linq next door and about the same price.

The service is great, the food is great, and the portions are great.  However- we were staying over a mile away and walked there ONLY because we had a $50 gift card to use.  When we went to pay, we were told our gift cards are not valid in Nevada or Oklahoma (where most of the restaurants are located).   So- we had to come up with  the cash (again- we only went there because we had the card- there were many places closer to where we are staying), and now we're still stuck with a gift card we can't use.  Tried calling the corporate office- number is no longer valid.  Currently waiting for the Las Vegas location to call me back with a good number to call.  Bottom line- DO NOT GO HERE TO USE A GIFT CARD BECAUSE THEY WON'T TAKE IT!!!

Only one star from me. I really don't love this bar.  

I was really disappointed with every aspect of this place.  Service was non existent.  She took a very long time for her to initially come to our table.  Our waitress was hardly seen the entire evening.  

My husband and I were splitting the nachos.  It's very rare for a place to mess up nachos.  I mean.... how can you mess up nachos? Well they succeeded in this.  Neither of us liked it.  There wasn't a good flavor at all.  You can choose chicken or beef.  We chose beef.  Little did we know it was a shredded beef and not a ground beef.  The beef was dry and cold.  Our friend was highly disappointed in his meal as well.  Again, no flavor in country fried steak.  Bummer.

Please trust me and skip this place.
seriously the best fries I have had in a long time...I am a HUGE Toby fan so I love this place

Food was decent,  I had the loaded nachos which were ok and my wife had the caprese burger which was great.   

The waitresses are dressed a little inappropriately for children,  but not the worst I've seen.

Burgers were super thick and tasty, but they use shredded lettuce and that's not so great on a burger. The fries are amazing! Seasoned and delicious. My bro and I finished off burgers with the Fried Twinkie which was actually pretty good. It's not a grease bomb like you'd think.

They have country music videos playing all the time and when Toby Kieth's "I Love This Bar" comes on everyone gets free shots poured directly in the mouth from a chick walking on the bar. Bras hanging above the bar keep the place extra classy.

The food's good, but I don't think the burger and fries are worth the $13-14 I paid. That's my only complaint. I do believe I'll return with friends so we can eat, drink and dance. Seemed like there was enough space by the video screen for some country dancin' and west coast swing.

What a fun place!  Live country music....good food....good drinks....just a good ol' country time!  I drowned myself in fried foods, but it was all sinfully delicious!  Fried pickles, country fried steak, and what better to end that all off with....fried twinkies!!!!!  (All washed down with drinks in mason jars!)  A very different experience for a break from typical "Vegas".  Highly recommended!

See my check in ... We haven't even sat down yet and already awful service.  I come here every time I visit Vegas..:: I come to the bar, that's great the restaurant... Not so much I'm pretty sure if I'm back it won't be my choice.

Very Good bar food with good portions for a pretty decent price for Vegas. Kind of difficult to find...you have to walk though Harrahs and then upstairs...but then again you have to always walk through something to get something in Vegas :)
Bartenders are cool. Good music live and on the sound system.  Drinks are good, times are great!!
A typical bar food fare, though a great break from the typical Las Vegas restaurant experience. Reasonably priced, great service, great pulled pork sandwich!

The food is good and the portions are large.  One of the most reasonably priced places to eat on the Vegas Strip.  The girls are wearing leather chaps, so I probably wouldn't take my kids there again, my boys (7and6) made a point of looking down when the waitress came by... it is Vegas though so it's kind of expected.  The service is VERY slow and the wait staff could be better.  Not sure if I would go back.
www.raeganmirickfoodblog.blogspot.com

Just found out that Toby Keith's doesn't do a free burger for vets, but I do get 20% off. So I'm having pancakes and hot links for lunch.

Ok.. so took 30 minutes to get my food, so hooray comps. So I snagged desert and left a good tip since I have no cash on me. Also... The hot links tasted like mildly spicy polish sausages.
Annnnnd apparently I must be black because of my opinion on the hotlinks, I heard this as being passed on from one of my waitresses coworkers. I brought this concern to the manager a Jerry O'Brien and he offered me his card and that my next meal there is on him. That is, if I ever return.

The one brought spot here was my waitress Dana, she did everything possible to give me a good experience?. Every restaurant could use 5 people like Dana at minimum.

Two stars only because of my waitress Dana.

OMG please do not believe the reviews..We did and $7.00 for a deep fried twinkie.  Plus we asked for ribs..reply sorry no more available, salad sold out...who are you kidding..The service was terrible and the cost was over $100.00 , one hamburger and shared a Turkey Club, one soda and two ice tea drink. I do not know who is writing these reviews..are you working for Toby Keith's bar and grill...Please waste your money somewhere else.
What can I say about Toby Keith's Bar & Grill?? Well, it's just that..a bar! Food was just mediocore & the service sucked!! Will definitely NOT be back

The group i was with was all in for this place - Me - I would not go back.  The food and service were sub-par.  Too many other great places in Vegas to be wasting my time at a less than average place.

If you are looking for average - this is your place.

I have never eaten here. 

Every time I have come here, its like 10 PM or later, I'm already drunk, and I have an amazing time. 

They have a band that plays and a DJ to play when the band is taking a break. 

The big drinks are served in Mason Jars. Which I'm kind of a sucker for. 

Strong drinks, fun bartenders, country music, and so much fun. 

I seriously love this place. I wish they had a bathroom inside, but its not really uncommon to not have a bathroom inside in Vegas. 

I will come back here every time I'm in Vegas.

If you are looking for a great place to get hammered, this bar is the one for you! Their 32oz (yes, 32oz!) mason jar drinks are an incredible deal and STIFF but still taste amazing! I am not a light weight by any means when it comes to drinking but after 1 1/2 of those drinks and a bar sweat shot I was done for. Not that I'm complaining one bit because it resulted in a fun evening with the hubby ;) and the bartenders made sure my hubby could get me home which was nice. 

I have no comment on the food as we only drank there. The bartenders were fun and charismatic and made killer drinks. 

Only downside is the fact that the location is horrible. We almost gave up looking for it because it was so far deep within the hotel. Otherwise if you are looking for a fun, relaxing bar to get your drink on I recommend taking the trek through the hotel to find it.

Hostess was not friendly, we couldn't sit in the restaurant side because we were only ordering appetizers, there is no service on the bar side, you get your own drinks and have to ask for a menu, seems run down from the last time we were here...Not impressed

The food might be good, but I'll never know. We were seated by the hostess who brought us our place settings and menus and told us our waitress would be right with us. I was kind of excited because they looked nice in there assless pants. Well we waited and we waited and oh we waited. Nothing.... no water, no cocktails, no appetizers. I looked around and the girls were nowhere to be seen. My wife and everyone else in my party looked at each other and said, "this is ridiculous, let's go" we got up and walked out. On the way out we told the hostess that no one ever came to help us. It wasn't her fault. So on the way out (outside of the restaurant) guess who we see. The waitresses literally taking ass pictures with other people. Well, I know where their priorities were. I have always wanted to try this place since I am a huge country fan. But, next time I walk by this place. I'm going to keep walking.

Went on 11/16/14 for a quick lunch with some friends. Great food. We all ordered different things and were all very impressed with the food. Delicious and generous portions.  Such a shame that they have such horrible service.  The hostess was rude and the waitress extremely slow and we had to keep asking the busboy to call our waitress for us.  Terrible and slow service but excellent food. Service is why I gave them a 3,  food only wood be a 5 star.

The prices in the gift shop seem rather high for a lot of items here! But did find a Toby Keith tshirt and a couple of other things.
Then we went to the bar and had 2 drinks, which was another Twenty dollar bill! Sad how expensive Vegas is getting!

If money and time are no object than come to the arena. You can get a 12 oz beer for $7 and a 20 oz beer for $14. We came for a concert that was supposed to start at 8pm and it's 10:21 pm and it still hasn't started. There has  been no announcements as to why. No DJ and nothing but waiting. A pretzel will cost you $8 and that's the low end of the price point. So if you have time and money to waste than it's a great spot!

My husband told me the chicken fried steak was awesome. After a long day of traveling I was excited to eat southern comfort food but I was a bit disappointed with the quality of my meal. The batter on the chicken fried steak was good and had a nice flavor. The inside was another story! The steak was tough and dry. I'm here for a few more days, but I doubt if I revisit. The hostess and waitress were nice, but the food was below average. Sorry hubby, I have to disagree with you on this one.

We used to love this bar and grill, but not anymore! Ribs were fatty, chicken fried steak was all breading, chili was horrible with a big ball of frozen sour cream in it!! Service was horrible!!  Prices too high for the quality of food.  We have never been so disappointed.  Coffee tasted like it was weeks old.  Needless to say, will not be back!

When I came to this bar I had a great time!!!
The music is all kinds of different. We heard varieties of Spanish, Country, Top 40 and Rock music here. I came after 10pm so I cannot comment on the food.
This bar is a great bar for all walks of life.
Everyone had a great time in my group, and every person that has been there and told me about it has said that they have had a great time there as well!
Try it out!

My husband and I visited on a recent mini vacation. We cannot vouch for the food as we did not eat a meal--we went for the music. But our experience was so great we went two nights in a row. The live music is really high quality--and no cover charge. Cheapest entertainment in Las Vegas (well, if you like country, which we do). The drinks were delicious, and potent, too :).

I "did not love this bar" Toby's place in OK City is great, this place is its polar opposite!  Was seated quickly then left &forgotten. Sat for 25min without so much as a hello or can I get you a drink? Toby Keith would of been very disappointed with this lack of hospitality. We got up, told the manager why we were leaving, then left.

Extra crispy and gooey deep fried mac and cheese from Toby Keiths bar and grill. Best mac and cheese balls! Comes with a side of cheese sauce. I preferred when it came with the southwest ranch instead which to my surprise is ranch and Salas mixed together.  Delicious !!!! Always great service !

We went here for my friend's 30th birthday (her choice) and had an amazing time. I don't even like country music and this was still the highlight night of our trip. There was a live band and they also played Top 40 hits in between sets. Our bartender, James, was freakin fabulous. He made us "sweet but strong" shots all night long. The only downside was the 24 hour recovery period, but that was likely my fault :) Can't speak to their food, but their bartenders, music and patrons made for a great night.

We got here early so we only had to wait a few minutes on a Thursday night...upon leaving the place had a LONG wait - people waiting on the inside and outside so tip: arrive early for dinner.

The service was slow....I think our waitress gave more attention to the tables of 4 or more (for the tip) over our table for two.  The fried mac & cheese balls made a fabulous appetizer.  The manager brought it out so I think it may have been sitting in the kitchen a little long and our food came out before we were done with it. 
We had the fried bologna sandwiches for dinner... I felt a little weird ordering that in a restaurant, but really - you can't get that just anywhere.  It was HUGE and filling and the drinks come in a large mason jar so you WILL fill up here though a price comes with it... this place is on the pricey side but due so such slow service, I was able to save some money on the tip so lessened it to the 15% range over 20.

We stopped by on a Thursday night and the place was hopping.  Drinks, while expensive, were good in taste and strong in booze.  Live music while we were there was extremely good, and it wasn't "just" country-country.  Some of the more recent country hits that blur the pop line were played and people danced on the dance floor anytime the songs welcomed it.

ps:  If you're coming in through the Monorail entrance, getting to this bar is a snap.  If you're coming in from the strip you want the escalators that take you towards the monorail as well as Starbucks.

Uh...kinda hate saying this but this wasn't that great.  The bartender tried hard but it took at least 45 minutes to get my half rack of ribs and they weren't that great (not terrible, but I've had better), toss in slightly high prices and a limited draft beer selection and there are better things out there and better things for the money.
I  (HEART) This Bar!  The dumplings were amazing, played slots with lunch, and bartender Jared was great!  Wins all around!

We used to love this place but yikes it has gotten pricey and the food is not that amazing.  We spent $65 for two burgers, onion rings and a beer!  Even by vegas standards that is pricey for a couple of burgers!  The wait is long and the atmosphere is crazy noisy at best.  This used to be a favorite vegas stop, but I think I have been there for my last visit.

This place sucks! The decor looks nothing like you would expect from a "country" bar. And the prices for drinks are OUTRAGEOUS. I'm use to paying 3 dollars or so for a domestic beer (Miller Lite) I'd even pay $4. But $6 is ridiculous. Even for the Strip. The mixed drinks are a minimum of $12 and they come in small glasses. My girlfreind wanted a sprite and that cost $3.50 and was in a small glass that you couldn't even put an entire can of sprite into...and it had ice in it! So this place is an obvious rip off. I HATE THIS BAR!

There are really only two reasons to come to this spot. 1) People watching. 2) To laugh at the shrine Toby Keith created to himself.

The music (when there is a live band) is actually pretty good. But the people watching is what brings me back again and again. The clientele here is so mixed. All the cowboys in town find their way here, but so do the bachelorette parties, woo girls, frat boys, football fans, old couples, etc. 

It gets quite packed at peak times. Bar and table service can be exceptionally slow. The food ain't much to write home about. The drinks are overpriced and kinda sucky. But you don't come here for the eating and drinking. You come here to walk around, shake your head, and repeatedly say to yourself "just who the hell does Toby Keith think he is?!" - and to just watch all the crazy people having a crazy time.

I was so excited to try a fried Twinkie and eat southern food all while listening to great music- guess ill have to make a trip back to Dallas bc this place was awful! No one in our 5 person party liked any item- not appetizers, entrees nor desserts! Cold, soggy, bland, dry, and overall unappealing. Visit the gift shop but skip the restaurant.

Well, this place is hopeless. I have been trying for 3 days to get through their phone line, and make a reservation. I have left a voicemail, and never received a call back. This place is not worth my time. I will not go to an establishment that neglects potential customers. I haven't even stepped foot in to this place and already they get one star for poor customer service. I can't imagine how it would be actually going here. For that, I will never give you my business.  Screw you Toby Keith's!
We took our crew of 12 Vegas goers to Toby Keith's. They got us seated quickly & the food was solid. From burgers to wings to nachos, we were all pleased w/ the food! The drinks are yum

So ok I got a groupon for this place and that's really the only reason we went in. Heck we aren't even country fans but I love groupon!! Ok so We were there on a Thursday (1/30/14) for lunch and we were seated right away. After looking over the menu I ordered the grilled chicken wrap and fries and the hubby ordered a club sandwich(sans fries, fries are extra) I was very excited to try my food because it looked good( sigh I should have ordered the burger the safest choice) . My wrap was huge BUT where was the chicken....I searched and searched and only pulled lots of lettuce and corn and then ohhh yes there is my one piece of chicken (huh?) blah not happy. My hubby must have seen the starved look in my eyes so he shared his club sandwich. It was actually good but then again can a person really mess up processed meats on bread? 
Well...I don't think id go back it just doesn't seem worth it. Our waitress was a peach but great service for not so good food ( ehh). I think next time I'll stick to American diner at the nyny hotel.

Really not my cup of tea.  I was given the "opportunity" to eat here with friends.  For me it's like Chili's meets the trailer park. Pretty run of the mill burgers and fries, The menu say "from the smoker" but ribs taste like Curley's from Costco.  Everything is dressed up with kitchy kountry names.  They still call french fries "Freedom Fries" - which may indicate the last time the menu was updated.  

Lots of country music videos running, thankfully not all Mr Keith's.  The hostess was friendly and she really tried, we had a big group and she held it together and the orders came out together.  The women here wear chaps with hot pants which I guess is Vegas "flair".  The service was good although they gave me chicken I didn't order on my salad - boiled and refrigerated from yesterday or so - it was getting a little extra flavor.  

It's cowboy meets run of the mill Vegas - if that's your thing, enjoy the Freedom Fries.  I wouldn't choose it.

I visited this bar about 9 months ago and was pretty disappointed with the staff, prices, cleanliness, and quality of the entertainment.  I revisited last week, and found that aside form the stupid high drink prices, the band was quite good, the staff was friendly and attentive, and it's cleaner.  James was a good bar tender.  If they only had reasonable drink prices, I would have spent more time there.  $7-8 for a domestic beer is just too much!
The foods always good and almost always have live music.  The flat iron steak was done right.  Sodas served in an ice cold mason jar
This is the place to go for some great atmosphere and drinks the size of your head. They cost a little extra, but just get the double, its worth the jar. Live band and dancers. Great time.

Wow - a lot of negativity in the reviews here.  I guess my expectations just weren't so high.  I expected average food and got that.  What I didn't expect was how much fun the dancing would be and that the music would be pretty good.  I've been here a couple of times and I think the bar area is pretty fun for a couple hours if you're in the mood for a casual and country bar.  Go to dinner someplace else.

It is what it is. It's basically a TGIFridays. But the vibe is good. Live band on the weekends and strong drinks. The wings are great and the food is solid. It's a good time in Vegas if you are too old for the club scene (sadly I am) . Go there have a good time eat drink and be merry

As the song says "I love this bar". You'll see old folks dancing and having a great time, you'll see young and old chicks flashing their titties for drinks. Great bands at 9pm every night and good bartenders. They do that flair crap but we can wait the extra minute for our drinks. Oh yes, the drinks... They have a good list of specialty drink like "Whiskey Girl" and "Pondskipper" or whatever that are GREAT and they serve them in Mason Jars. They are a bit pricey at $18 but you will only need one. You can get any drink or beer in the Mason Jars. 

They do play nothing but country music. How bad is that really? It's not like it's Hip Hop, still a lot of people won't come here. To them we say; just realize that you aren't as cool as you think you are so just fucking go and have a good time. This is another tourist trap and a hell of a good one too. The people-watching is top notch and people will actually talk your ear off. As you know, we like tourist traps, maybe because we like being a tourist... Fuck we wish we were somewhere being tourists right now. Oh boo hoo, suppose we'll have to be satisfied with places like Toby Keith's.

"I Love This Bar". Great song, great place.
Now I'm going to rate this place strictly as a bar, not as a grill, as I did not have any of the food. I came here on a Thursday night, and got in at about 10:30. No ID check, No cover charge, just walk on in and head up to the bar. Very cool.
There was a live band playing, but they were very, very good. Played mostly country, but threw in some old classics to get people on the dance floor. It's a very modern country type atmosphere, and a LOT of fun. Noticed the bras hanging all around the bar, always kind of funny to notice the different sizes and styles. 
All the drinks are served up in mason jars, pretty cool. Lots of beers on tap, although I decided with a Long Island Ice Tea. Very strong, and very good. Since it was my birthday, the bartender hooked me up with a free shot. Not quite sure what it is, but free booze is free booze. After about 30 minutes, the band decided to take a break, and a live DJ started up playing country hits, announcing FREE SHOTS at the bar. And boy, they weren't kidding. EVERYBODY made their way over to the bar, and the bartenders hooked everyone up with a free shot. Of course, the beautiful ladies had it poured into their mouth from the large dispenser, as it should be.
The bartenders were very cool, made some very cool drinks, and were very interactive with all the people hanging at the bar. The band was pretty damn good, and had a LOT of people on the dance floor. One young lady, TRASHED beyond belief, had everyone's attention, especially after throwing her panties to the drummer. A lot of folks boot scootin' and doing the electric slide. 
Good music, good times, and not a bad price. Definitely recommend this place as a chill alternative to the night clubs that dominate the Vegas scene. Stop in, relax, enjoy some good country, and drink your face off.

Why do they play hip hop here? I typically love this place. I love the live music and some good two-stepping, but that can be difficult with all of the drunks stumbling all over the dance floor waiting for a Kanye song. 

I love Vegas, I love a good drunk crowd, but I also love my country. If I wanted booty shaking I would go elsewhere, but if I go to Toby Keith's, I want some country.

Live music, pictures, sports, super good food, and nice drinks! Coming from MI to see this restaurant - inside Harrah's - was amazingly cool! The ribs were sweet and smoked fresh! The baked beans had the right heat and the mashed potatoes were wholesome. The Whiskey Girl drink was big but still delicious! Keep it up guys! Tourists all over the place. Also the band played Alan Jackson and Johnny Cash so that was great.

I didn't hold out much hope for anything inside a Harrah's casino.  But a bunch of my friends that I haven't seen in a couple of years were going there to catch up and talk about an awesome day of flying.

For a Wednesday night, it was cool that there was a band.  And the band wasn't that bad.  But thats where the positives ended.  It took forever to get served a drink.  And I got a weird look when I asked for a diet Coke. (Sorry Toby minion. Despite your valiant attempt to get me to buy a jar of booze, I didn't feel like getting wasted when I had to fly 13 hours later).  The floor was sticky almost everywhere near the bar.  And even though it was only 10pm, some drunk moron dropped his drink on the ground and walked away.  No big deal right? Now you'd think a waitress would get a mop and clean it up.  But nope, they just put a cone over the spill.  It was as if no one noticed as the spill grew exponentially from underneath the cone.

Wehaa!!
Hubby OF"COURSE loved this bar....the gal..hey hey hey "BARTENDER" was cute as a button and very polite...yet funnyyy as all get out and looked like the original Dukes of Hazrds gal!! She also said she had been there since that very bar opened.....I believe she said she 34 and of'course u would not have known it..she had 2 ponytails..and could dance all over that bar in cowboy boots ..and cutoff shorts..lol and pour your drinks backwards off that bar into your mouth or glass...!!  
We needed that lil afternoon break...fun fun!!  then of to gambling!!

As a Christmas present to my Mom, I took her to Vegas to see Garth Brooks at the Wynn. She is a huge country fan, so I really wanted her to enjoy herself on our two day trip. So we HAD to see her favorite (Toby Keith's) bar at Harrah's. My expectations for Harrah's wasn't high at all, and it met those expectations.

"I Love This Bar" was basically the Hard Rock Cafe for Country meets Coyote Ugly. The place was loaded with Toby's records and hats and shirts he wore at certain events. The staff was sexy delicious. The outfits were as follows: cowboy hat, little black shirt that reads "HOTTIE", black booty panties, and black assless leather chaps. Possibly the greatest work uniform of all time? I think so.

The food was just ok. I got a western burger and it was gigantic. The fries were "crusty" and meh. Toby's "I Love This Bar" song and video came on and they announced free shots - so I ran over to the bar where the bartenders dump it straight from bottle inti to your mouth. Not a spritz either, like fill your mouth from throat to lips. Savage style. I kinda like it. Just because Mom had to try it - we got the Deep Fried Twinkie for dessert. When in Rome...

All in all, a cool place to drink and fantasize about your server. Food was pretty decent. I've got a new respect for TK. Definitely a cooler spot than Sammy Hagar's or Vince Neil's. And I'm not even a Country fan.

4.25 stars. But why no mechanical bull? You'd think it's a no brainer.

We've been here several times. We love the music and the atmosphere but the food is only so-so. This trip, we had the steak, the pulled pork sandwich, the She's a Hottie wrap and the nachos. We didn't care for the nachos. Everything else was good, but not great. The menu seems to be more limited than it has been in the past.  Love the mason jars. I would give 3 1/2 stars if I could.

Slowest. Service. EVER. Came here on a Sunday night, so it wasn't exactly busy. Took about 45 minutes to be seated, although there were several empty tables.  Server was super friendly, just not the greatest at her job. Food was just ok... Not bad, but not great. I had the Grilled Chicken Wrap, and I probably wouldn't order it again if I came back (which I probably never will). The water is super chlorine-y, so yuck. Fries were pretty tasty however. Took about another 30 minutes to get/pay our bill. Sorry Toby Keith - can't say that I love this bar....

I really do LOVE this bar! In my opinion this is the best bar around, and after last call you can just head on down to the Carnival Court which is open later!

You can order your drink in a mason jar for $19. Seems pricey, but considering most drinks in Vegas are about $12 this is a really good deal. 

Every time I go there is a fun band playing, and in between sets the DJ will play a mix of music (not just country.) If you are lucky enough you will be there on a night where locals lead line dancing. 

Overall this is a really fun place and my favorite spot in Vegas.

I've tried this place twice and both times I went here with high expectations and both times I left dissappointed. The ambiance is cool and country but the service is lacking. The food is not neccessarily bad, but its not top notch by any means.

I'm not a country western fan and I don't know who Toby Keith is other than someone my girlfriend was drooling over. But I do know that country-western people know how to eat, so I was all up for visiting this bar/grill while we visited Vegas. 

It's inside Harrahs on the strip. 
It didn't open until 11 which was a bit annoying, considering how hungry I was at 10 am, but eventually it did. Like many chains, there is a feeling of "same old same old" the moment you walk in, just like any Jimmy Buffet Margaritavilles or a Applebees. 

There was lot of country music and videos on the TV, mostly Toby Keith, and there are bra's hanging around the bar. A country western bar for sure! There is a stage for live music. The cool thing to do is order your beer in a giant mason jar (just Coors for the mason jar only). I hate Coors but I figured when in Rome....

The next day we popped by once again so she could get some souvenirs from the gift shop and pose with the cut-out photo of Toby. We did order up some chili fries and they were delicious which confirms my theory that the food here must be pretty good, in a chain kind of way. Hot and fresh and plentiful. Overall it lacks an original feeling. But I do plan to hit one up in Phoenix next time, so it did its job, but I'll avoid the Coors. Yuck.

I only gave this place 3 stars because they have live country music bands perform there each night (bands that were chosen directly by Toby Keith himself supposedly).  The band was great the night I was there and the bar is nice and large, almost the size of a dance hall.  It's located on the 2nd floor of Harrahs, which is something most people need to know when trying to find this place.  Otherwise, I was not a big fan of this place simply because the domestic beer prices for BOTH bottle and draft were $7 EACH.  I can buy an entire six pack for that price!!  Since it was probably the last time I would ever visit Vegas again in my lifetime, I sucked it up and stayed for a little while.  However, I wouldn't go back.  Since there are very few good choices for country music bars in Vegas, I would recommend this place for those who are desparately looking for a country music bar in Vegas and don't mind paying $7 per beer.  They may have a happy hour with lower prices, but I cannot confirm that.  I know the bands start at 9pm each night and Happy Hour is over by then, if there is one at all.
Really delicious burger and drink (toadfish pond or something like that). All around good.

The food we ordered was alright, but the service was atrocious. There was a larger party seated after us and from that point on, our server seemed to forget any of us even existed (another couple across from us couldn't get his attention either). Ended up having to track down a manager just to get our check and some carryout containers.

In addition to that, it's incredibly dark in there, so much so that even reading the menu was hard to pull off without pressing it to your face.

Also, why are all the female servers seemingly required to wear either backless chaps with their panties completely visible or way too short shorts? Not sure who at corporate made that call, but here's a tip: Let the food be your reason to be there, not some pointless lowbrow nonsense like that.

Honestly, if this was a standalone place outside of a casino, it wouldn't last long with all these issues.

Let me start off by saying I LOVE country music so of course i had to visit Toby Keith! I felt like i was in the south because of the atmosphere and items on the menu. 
I would have given 5 stars but our server was very ditsy and a bit rude. Order the nachos! Bombbb salsa!

The place was dirty, staff was very slow to serve/take care of customers ( the bar only had about 15 people in it ). We ordered nachos as an appetizer, when they arrived they were cold the chicken tasted like something out of a can the meat I'm assuming was hamburger was bland and had a hint of taco seasoning on it and of course we had nachos without any plates, napkins or silverware......
The total tab two beers and nachos was over $ 35.00 before tip, if you want to see I love this bar for yourself save your money walk in turn around and walk out !

One of our favorite meals while we were in Vegas. The breading on the mac&chz balls is so flakey and yummy. The chicken on the Caesar salad was great and so was the dressing. The fried Bologna was some of the thickest cut I've ever seen. We had the fried twinkies for desert which had the same amazing breading as the mac&chz balls.

Horrible service. Waitress only came to our table twice and the place wasn't even busy. Tried to pay with card but she never came back for our checks so we had to scrounge together enough cash. Had to wait way too long for food and it wasn't even good. Macaroni and cheese tasted worse than easy Mac. Too overpriced for the quality of the food. $8 for a red solo cup of domestic beer.
I had the rib sandwich and it was delicious!  The bar tender did jack me and my friends and didn't return with the tip but it didn't take away from the great food and really cute waitresses.

first of all, i hate country music. can't stand it. and you're wondering, why go here then?! well, i was starving, it was midnite and we were looking for a place to serve their $7.99(?) steak and eggs all day specials.

i want to give more stars cuz i had a great time, but there were still some issues with this place. 

so, we get here at midnite or so on a weeknite. we're waiting in the crazy ass line just to get seated. there were 2 hostesses and they were complete crap. not nice, not friendly, fat women. ugh! not even a smile!!! anyways, we finally get seated. our waiter appeared to be only 1 of 3 waiters in the whole place. our waiter was really nice (a hispanic guy), but it looked like he was serving 10-15 tables (same as the other waiters). totally overworked. those hostesses? just walking around and harrassing our waiter to hurry up. i also work at a business that helps people out. i don't care what your freaking actual job description is. if i was that hostess, i would have helped bus the tables. not stand around gaining more pounds.

anyways, we told our waiter that we wanted the steak and eggs special. we were starving. the food came out so FAST. the steak, of course, was too dry and tough to eat. but, my eggs were made TO PERFECTION (exactly the way i love my eggs!) . the potato hash was awesome and the bread was good. after eating all of that, my stomach was super happy. i didn't eat most of the steak, but i'm ok with that. so freaking cheap.

and the country music?! well, they actually mixed up the country music with some main stream music (Lady Gaga, etc) so it wasn't too bad. even the country music wasn't that bad! shocker! i dunno, but somehow their country music was OK! and i hate country music! lol! 

the steak and eggs special was great, but don't expect high quality for so cheap. 

i might even come here again. even bigger shocker! lol

This place should seriously just be called Toby Keith Bar. We went there tonight with a very large group of people, families, but the kids were aged between 14 and 20. We dropped down a combined $800 to $1000 on food and drinks. The food was just ok, I ordered the pulled pork which tasted ok but was a bit soggy. We were got there at about 9 pm and ate and then were just hanging out listening to the music and dancing. All of a sudden we are informed but a security gard that the dance floor is part of the bar, even though it is in the restaurant, and that our teenage girls had to get off the dance floor. Keep in mind they are all real dancers and not drunks staggering around with a beer in their hand and it is hard for them to hear music and not be compelled to do what they do best. 

Anyway in the end after complaining that we did not think a restaurant that allowed families should have this sort of policy banning their customers from dancing, we were basically escorted out of the restaurant by the security as the manager didn't want to deal with our argument. Punch line to this story. Toby Keith's is not a Grill but a Bar with food (bar food) and if you have kids well they will take you hard earned money but they really don't want you there, best to not go!

The food was overpriced, even for the strip and if you don't hit happy hour the drinks are too expensive as well...that said they have some great bartenders who are probably the best flair tenders i've ever seen. That and the staff make you feel welcome..a nice change on the Strip from the cattle line mentality of most places.Overall, a mixed bag, but just edges into the three stars range...

Great atmosphere! Great food! Great music! Couldn't be happier with my dinner. The prices are good for the amount of food they give you. The beer was super cold and the service was good also. I would like to come back here very soon.

horrible, horrible experience!!! Service was the worst ever! We got sat at a table and it took the waitress at least 10 min to take our drink orders. When she came back we placed our food orders and got an appetizer. That took at least another 15-20 minutes! (all we ordered was chips and salsa w/ queso dip..not much prep required). We finally got our entrees and asked for some ranch, more water, and a soda. Ranch was brought to our table AFTER we had already finished eating and refills were never brought! Not only the service sucked but I was NOT impressed by the food for how pricey everything was! Such a disappointing experience for such a big name. Definitely wont be going back there!!

I'm a frequent guest at the Caesar's Hotels.  I love this bar.  I found the food good, the drinks thirst satisfying and the service outstanding.   Since I dropped $2K on the blackjack tables, I have no axe to grind.

I was roped into going here as part of a cousins birthday party, and after checking the reviews I knew I was in for a special night.

The wait was long, the servers paid little attention to the tables, and half of the parties orders came to the table incorrectly prepared.

Also what's with the GIGANTIC buns? They almost made the burgers inedible.

Also, I understand that it's a Toby Keith bar, but I was not prepared to be inundated by the same 3 song Toby Keith playlist over and over.
But hey, at just the waitresses are walking around in their underwear.

Tldr: expensive, slow, and mediocre food.

This is one of my most favorite bars to hang out in while in Vegas! It is always fun with dancing, flare bartenders, mason jars, and birthday "shots". 

I actually prefer to come here during the day because most of the bartenders are really personable and you get a really cool show while they throw bottles around and pour 20 shots at a time in a pyramid. They are able to talk with you moer and spend more time showing off their cool tricks than they are at night when it is super busy. AND they still play the Toby Keith song, "I Love This Bar" during the day- which means free shots! 

I keep coming back to this place despite the fact that I am not that big into country music and I absolutely despise Toby Keith. So, that really says something about how fun this bar is!

Last note, go on your birthday and order the birthday shot. Trust me :)

Nice, clean and friendly place. Ordered Turkey club on wheat, which came with fries and a pickle spear. Food was good. Diet Pepsi served in a huge mason jar. The band that played was LOUD, and they were on the other side of the restaurant. I would recommend this place without hesitation.

Good food and great drinks in a Country themed environment.  If you like Country music, you will love this bar.  I am a business executive and I travel to Vegas about 5 times per year over the last 10 years or so.  I stumbled into Toby Keith's about 5 years ago, and I can honestly say it is the one place I look forward to going to every trip.  It doesn't disappoint.  It feels like home even though I'm from the O.C. and I'm not a huge Country fan.  My man Jay Bird has always made the experience fun at the bar.  He's a great guy to have a laugh with.  He makes drinks with this whole flair process with bottles and tumblers and glasses flyin' every which way before it all lands cleanly in your glass.  Very entertaining.  I usually go here in the evening, but this week I decided to have lunch here.  I ordered the pulled pork sandwich, Mac & Cheese balls, and the tortilla soup.  In the background, I was entertained by Toby Keith's mostly hilarious music videos.  Food came reasonably fast.  The food was really good. Unexpectedly good.  I washed that down with a mason jar of my favorite beverage and I felt like I had great experience for a reasonable value.

Just like his song "Mm, mm, mm, mm, mm, I love this bar."  Drinks are cold and the bar tenders are awesome.  I saw the sign for this walking around and as I passed by so I decided to go in because it was one of the places that did not allow smoking and they had a love band playing Toby Keith songs.  It was a great time and the place being in the back of the hotel was jumpin.....

Food is good but it used to be better. Also seams the menu has gotten smaller. We still enjoy going to TK for the bands and dancing.  Bartenders are great and we always have a good time. Good mix of people, older and young crowd.
Loved the Toby Keith bar!  We had a good time sitting at the bar watching football.  The service was better than expected.  The drinks are awesome and are served in huge mason jars!

me and my mate went here as a spare of the moment decision I had the BBQ pulled pork sandwich with fries and it was good but nothing really popped apart from the waitresses they were really nice and helpful gotta love them uniforms definitely a restaurant for the lads

Girls in cowboy hats and chaps, drinks in mason jars, great country music on the radio.....
so far so good!
The food was half decent (expensive though, like most restaurants in casinos), the portions are very generous, decor was quite nice.   
We enjoyed ourselves.   We'd probably go back on our next trip there.
Group of 8 and had no desire to seat us!! Did not want to let us split up I to 4 and 4. Wanted to put us all on one check!! Not toe room receptionist was pushing 50 in buttless chaps!
Food was great, employees were a treat, music was entertaining, but no Toby Keith. Was worth it.

The worst meal I had in Vegas. 
That's disappointing because I like Toby Keith. But I can unequivocally say, I hate this bar. 
We had been out all day sightseeing and we needed a decent supper before bed. Harrah's has a bar that is themed after a Toby Keith song. I love this bar. So it looked kind of slow but there were folks eating at several tables. We have eaten at several of the restaurants  in the casino and they've been good. We got seated as we walked up and the waiter came and took our order. Hot wings for her and Fish and chips for me. When they brought her wings they left off the ranch. My order was complete but not completely fried. The breading on the cod fish was not crisp. It was soggy and a little runny on the inside. I took a bite and it was super hot temp wise. But the whole thing fell apart like it had been dunked in water. All of the fish were like this. The fries and slaw were good. As far as the wings went. They were still partly frozen. I grabbed the tip of the wing on one and it was literally cold to the touch. After spending the day in death valley, I'm very aware what hot vs. cold is. This was poor execution of what should be a simple fried order. 
One more thing. The sweet tea was way too sweet. Don't get me wrong,  I love sweet tea. I'm a southern guy and I've had sweet tea since I was 3 probably. I like it sweet. But not this sweet. Maybe you shouldn't even try to be southern, Vegas.

Wow the portions of food were very generous.  We had a table of 7 and we ordered the fried mac n cheese as an appetizer.  I would have never tried this if it weren't for someone at the table that said you gotta try this!  It was very good indeed!  No one was able to finish thier food except two at the table that ordered soup.  I ordered 1/2 order of Nachos that looked like it could serve 3 for sure!  My friend orderd chicken fried steak w/mash potatoes & gravy and it looked great and he said it was very good. The chicken & dumpling soup, tortilla soup also looked great and my friends both finished and loved it.  Alcoholic beverages we served in big glass canning jars so the % of alcohol to mixer was week but overall the ambiance and food was great!  Would do it again!

Based off my experience this past Saturday night, I'd give this little hidden spot five stars. Why? Well, for starters the bartenders were nice. They didn't treat you like they didn't have time for your order. Next, the dance floor was busy but not ...hey, I just going to hold off going to the bathroom because if I leave this 1x1 inch square I've carved out for myself, there is no way in hell I'm getting it back, feeling. Finally, the music! If you think it's solely country music, think again. Maybe it was the band this past Saturday (8/29/15) but they played a wonderful mix of contemporary and old school country, classic rock, old school hip hop (gin & juice, anybody?), and a little 90's rock. 
I had a heck of a time...in a good way. So much so that I think I sang my little heart out to where the next morning I was sounding like Carol Channing (RIP).
Food was average. Drinks (even non-alcoholic) way over priced. Five dollars for tea or a soda?? Would have given two stars, however loved the band that started at 9PM.

Ok this is the place to go when you are hungry!  Big portions! 
I absolutely love the meatloaf potato bites,  and sweet tea, a must have:) The BBQ burgers the boom! Taste bursting with sweet and spicy the meat prime quality!  
The restaurant has country music and videos playing all around the walls loved it... the service was outstanding!

If I could give zero I would. Not once did the bar tenders ask if we wanted drink. It took a really long time to order my food.. food was subpar for the price. Take your money and spend it at Ramsey's pub and grill. Been here for an hour and I had to get the servers attention for my ONE drink, to order, and as I write this I still haven't gotten my bill.. I'm a total Rewards member and I gambled on the video poker machines and still no love. I was ready to spend money and the service was subpar. Barring Toby Keith sitting with me for a beer, I'll probably never come back. Take your money elsewhere folks.

I have been here a few previous times and loved it; however, this time I did not! I had my heart set on having the chili burger, but was disappointed that they changed their menu and no longer have it. I ordered another burger and asked for cheddar cheese. They gave me a different burger than what I ordered. The waitress had them cook me the burger I ask for but the new one had swiss cheese instead of the cheddar I asked for. No apologies. The waitress actually thought it was funny I was mad. Won't be back..

If you want to have a blast of a time in Vegas without a pretentious atmosphere, this is your place! They have a live band from 9 pm - 2 am. Probably the most fun I had the entire time I was in Vegas. 

Pros: fried mac & cheese balls, 32 oz drinks in mason jars, killer dance floor and live band

Cons: hard to get service from the assless chap clad wait staff during dance hours. Gotta muscle your way to the bar unless you're ordering a full dinner.

Well after Ruth Chris was over pack I decided to go here I didn't really like the name but ok so I went there and order my favorite drink Long Island ice tea and bbq and mac and cheese the drinks the big drinks was and chicken was good the Mac n cheese seems like a box food they need to relearn how to cook it but I would go again I jus wouldn't order the Mac and cheese
I LOVE this bar and grill. The prices are reasonable, the portions are huge and the music is pure Toby and friends. A must see if you have out-of-towners who like country and down home food.

The food was great! The steak sandwich was truly a good steak on bread, unlike some places where they grill a piece of dried leather & add mushrooms. And the fries were excellent.

BUT... As one might expect on the Strip, it's expensive. The $15 price tag on my dinner was expected, but I felt like I'd just lost big in Vegas at the sticker shock of paying $7 for a domestic beer and $12 for a small margarita. Oh... And there is a lot of ass-cheek in the room provided by your waitresses who put Hooter's girls to shame. I guess you'll have to decide for yourself whether that's a plus or minus... 

Can I say "ass-cheek" on Yelp?

Facts about me:
I am from a large, northern city.
I do not own a cowboy hat or boots
I do not own a pickup, or other large SUV
I do not listen to country music
I sort of enjoy Toby Keith's I Love This Bar & Grill

Maybe it's because it takes SO LONG to find the place that I was just really hungry/thirsty, but I found myself having a good time here.  The food isn't anything outstanding, but after all the glitz of Vegas, it's a nice "loaded nachos and beer" breather.  We were there on a weekday afternoon and the place was dead, so service was very attentive.  No clue what it's like on a busy night.

Where is the negative one star?

I've not been here in years but to say service has been degraded is an understatement.

We waited 10+ minutes at the bar for service and even then it was sketchy. One bartender spent the entire time fraternizing with two patrons while we and others waited without drinks or service.

The "free" cornbread was stale and dry, worth every cent it cost. The butter was good but limited.

The bartender recommend the fried mac and cheese which I love but these things were near tennis ball size and tasted horrible, not recommended.

I had to ask for another drink twice and it wasn't even busy.

The strange thing is the butter that came with the corn on the cob was hard and tasteless, not sure why they didn't use the same butter they had with the cornbread is beyond me, at least that was good.

Horrible experience. Service sucked and the food was horrible, won't be returning.

Of all of the things we did in 3 nights, this was the best! Friendly bar staff, reasonable prices. Very good band the night we were there. People watching was excellent! The line dancing and country music was worth it all! We had 2 orders of wings, they were very dry.  Also, it would have been nice for someone to pick up our food after we were done eating. The drinks in Mason jars and atmosphere are what gave it such high ratings. Food not so much.

I waited longer for a table than I would have expected given that the place wasn't quite full. The food was very slow to arrive, as well. 

The Cajun Shrimp appetizer was decent -- a large portion, served hot, with a tasty dipping sauce. I believe the menu description is inaccurate in that the shrimp itself is not spiced at all. Not to say it's bad, just not what I was expecting.

The veggie wrap -- admittedly, not what most patrons are going to order in the land of excess that is Las Vegas -- was awful. The filling was about 95% shredded lettuce, with a few other bits of stuff thrown in for color, and a dressing that was not so much bland as just yucky. I considered sending it back, but it was nearly the only thing on the menu that didn't used to have hooves. By which I mean, I didn't have a lot of vegetarian-ish choices.

The service was slow throughout the meal, and the waitress had a habit of timing her drive-bys when I had a mouthful of food and couldn't say anything. As fast as she was moving, you'd think she'd make it back around more frequently, but no. Don't let your drink glasses get empty, as you'll be sitting there thirsty for a while.

All that said, the setting is lively, especially later at night when there's a band on stage. I'm not a fan of country or western, but I'd watch just about any good band live. 

If you're just going for a quick meal, you're better off elsewhere (e.g. next door at Imperial Palace there's a decent homestyle mexican place).
Fun bar! Had live cover band and DJ Friday night. Drinks are light on alcohol.  But band was entertaining.
Always a good time..Bands are hit or miss. Better on the weekends. Best pours when you order at the bar.
Delicious food!  Friendly service!  Cute outfits . Good atmosphere. Great music. Easy to find via monorail.

I went here twice on my last trip to Vegas and it is now going to be a stop I make every time I go down.  The first time was midday, probably around 3 in the afternoon and the place was dead but I wanted to go in for a drink.  They bartenders were friendly.  They temped me by putting a menu in front of me, where by boyfriend spotted the "Fried Bologna Sandwich" that he just HAD to try.  So we ordered it... and now I have a new favorite food.  The sandwich was AMAZING, and I don't even like bologna.  I would recommend it in a heartbeat. I also got some specialty margarita and it was delicious.  We went back the following night, probably around midnight and there was a band and the place was packed.  We had a great time dancing and having some drinks.  The beers in a mason jar are classic.  We bought two from the bar to take home.

This bar and grill is alway a must when we come to Vegas for the finals rodeo! (With the exception of this year because of the babe). It has such a fun vibe. They even have a live band every so often. The drinks are great and they have such a wide variety of them. The staff is very friendly and have great music playing!

Good not great. Typical burger type place that is country music themed. There are TVs all over the place so if you want to watch the sports games it's available. I've been here a couple times and service is hit and miss and isn't very consistent. I guess it's the luck of the draw of who your waitstaff is. Food was fresh the burgers were large and tasty. I had the grilled chicken bbq salad and it was huge. Make sure you have a large appetite. Drinks were expensive 6 dollars for a bottle of domestic beer.

Sat at the bar with my wife, with the hopes that this would provide the best service......wrong! 

She is  active duty, so she inquired about the free burger. Well after 20 min of waiting on drinks.. (7 people in the entire place), the bartender says " I have give you 20% off but not a free burger cause your ordering the 18 dollar one and not the 17 dollar one". Offered to pay the dollar difference but no dice. Anyway, got ignored for service for the rest of the time we were there, bartender was busy hitting on a lady at the other end of the bar, in which several people that tried to order ended up walking out. Avoid this place!

Was in town for a conference and took 4 of my teachers to I Love This Bar! Service, food and drinks were great! Music and the videos were fun as well. Only thing keeping it from a 5 Star review is the servers dressed in chaps showing their ass. I mean this is not hooters is it? The servers can dress sexy without dressing like Vegas showgirls.

My coworkers and I placed a large order to-go and the food came out pretty fast. Once we started eating though... Oh boy... A couple meals were decent BUT we had a couple issues. 

American Soldier Burger: had tough, bone-like pieces in it. Coworker about broke his tooth. When we called and informed the restaurant, they told us we could bring it back. 

Chicken and Dumpling soup. BLAND. Not like grandma's at all!!! It's made with biscuits, not actual homemade dumplings. Tasted like garlic biscuits. 

I personally would not order from here again.  The server was very friendly, but the food overall was not impressive.

If you love country, this is the place in Vegas for you!

My boyfriend surprised me and took me to Vegas for my birthday and it was my first time at the Toby Keith bar. I'd heard about it from friends who loved it and I sure loved it too. The bar is very big with lots of tables and a dancing area to dance to the live band. I didn't get any food since we all just wanted to get drinks. The staff was friendly and served quickly. The music is loud and the drinks are strong! They're a little expensive but I guess it makes sense since they're served in huge mason jars. Seriously they're huge and really heavy and I'm not complaining. I got a long island for $30 in a big mason jar and it's totally worth it.

We stayed for quite a while dancing until a little after the band took a break. This place has a great vibe and an awesome atmosphere. I'll definitely be returning when I come back to visit.

Good food, great service , awesome atmosphere! I had the grilled chicken spinach wrap with ranch BBQ sauce home-made coleslaw and a garlic pickle spear---all very fresh and delicious! Will visit again on my next trip back to Vegas.

Went for lunch here today, and had been here a few years ago, and this trip was very disappointed.  I wanted a salad and there was not much to choose from, (or anything else) on the menu.

I ordered the build yourself salad which stated it was the ranch salad and then you add on grilled chicken, fried chicken or shrimp, I got the fried chicken, it was supposed to have cucumbers, red onions, tomatoes, cheese & roasted corn on it.

It was mostly all iceberg lettuce, there was hardly any chicken, no cucumbers or onions and barely any corn & onions and to boot it was $14.99.

I felt it was a rip off, the worst salad I have had for a long time.

My husband ordered the All American Burger, which came on a big bun, but the meat didn't even touch the edges of the bun, he said it was not very tasty, and it cost $13.99.

Will not be returning here again, too high price for under average food.
Servers look you in the eye then ignore you when you are the only customer standing at the bar wanting a drink. Incredibly, egregious customer service.

Good wings and Nachos. The Catfish was overrated. After we were seated it took 15 minutes before anyone came to take our order or even acknowledge us. Several staff members walked by and did not check on us. I wont return.

The food and atmosphere is great! But the servers are SO rude I had to go with 1 star. We had a group of 7. 1 person, who ordered a 20$ drink, wasn't hungry so the servers told her she needed to sit in the bar while the rest of us ate. For 7 people to order over 200$ I expect better service. I'm really disappointed because this is one of my favorite stops.

Honestly, I did not know who Toby Keith until I actually looked him up on the Internet while we were dining.

When we are in Las Vegas, I often pick the place to eat when I am with my family.

However, this time around, since we were Casino hopping via the Monorail; I capitulated to the group's choice.

We normally eat at the other establishments and we don't go to Bar & Grills. But since everyone was famished, and they wanted to eat NOW, they chose the closest restaurant to our stop.

We were greeted by the hostess as we walked through the entrance. She was very pleasant and nice. This seemingly impromptu choice by my family seemed like it would turn out to be a good choice. The place was brightly lit, clean, spacious, and there were not that many patrons so we had plenty of great seats to choose from.

The hostess grabbed the menus, exited from the booth that she was situated in, and led us to our table. Now, the punch line here is that as we followed her; none of us could help but notice the fact that she was wearing chaps and nothing was covering her rear except for very small (and nearly non-existent) panties.

Well, this was a great choice - Family!? I had this perplexed look on my face, as I stared onto my wife's and daughter's grinning faces!

Derrière's aside, and there was plenty of it, the food and the service were actually not bad. Our waitress was very prompt and attentive to our needs.

I had the All American Burger, that this monstrosity of a sandwich could've fed all of us. It seemed as if the quoted weight of this burger was post cooking, because It definitely was too big to hold with one hand - let alone put any part of it in my mouth.

My wife had the Ribeye, and she indicated that it was well seasoned, and properly prepared.

The rest had various sandwiches, BBQ Beans, and Mac & Cheese. Everything tasted good.

This seemingly humorous departure from our normal dining venues proved both fun, relaxing and surprisingly satisfying. And by the time we were ready to leave, the lights were dimmed and the crowds started to roll in. Apparently, after a certain time, there is a band that plays on the stage, and country dancing ensues.

We didn't stick around for that, but we left satisfied!

Nice atmosphere and fun place but food was very mediocre. I ordered the sirloin medium and it came out a bit over poked and quite rubbery. Catfish could have certainly been cooked longer for better crisp and color. Sides were small and their green beans were not seasoned at all. Presentation of the dishes were very thrown together and as soon as you see the dish, you know you're going to be let down. For a good time and drinks, I would recommend. For a good meal, look elsewhere.

I ordered a vegi wrap and fries to go, got back up to the room and found they didn't include the fries (which I watched him ring up as an extra charge). If you charge $23 for wrap and fries I expect it to be good... disappointing.
Tito was awesome at the bar. He was very friendly and fun to talk to. Beer was yummmmmm and the portobello burger was the bomb!!! Sheeesh I totally forgot to take a pic of the best burger ever.

The name should be "I love this bar" nix the grill part.

As a bar this place is pretty good. The wait, service and food sucks.

We put our name in for dinner and were told 45-60 minute wait. Twenty minutes into our wait Robby Gordon shows up and they slip him right in front of everyone.

At the fifty minute mark I asked where we were on the list, we were told 15 more minutes.

At the 90 minute mark we were finally seated.

We got our drinks pretty quick then it took another 15 minutes for our server (Lisa) to take our order.

In all we had two cheese burgers, one chili burger, two waters, one iced tea and a lemon drop martini. The bill came to $60.00. My chili burger had zero flavor. Which begs to ask "how do you screw up a chili burger"? Well this place knows how.

Like I said at the beginning, good bar...horrible restaurant. Never again.

Toby Keith needs to remove his name from this place...quickly.

I appreciate Toby Keith's musical ability, but if this restaurant is any indication of his culinary skills, he needs to hang em up. This place is horrible. Server recommended the steak, it was bad quality, mac and cheese was a step above Kraft. Pepsi products as well. My wife's nachos were literally inedible,  she had to send em back which she never does. If we hadn't had a free meal coupon from a timeshare thing, we never would have come after seeing the reviews, and now even with the coupon we wouldn't come back.

Fun. Good value. Good southern comfort food. Enjoyed the chicken fried steak.  mac and cheese very cheesy which means a lot to someone from Wisconsin. Good burger and fries. Good drinks--definitely had sufficient alcohol.  Unlike many LV joints.  Would def go back.

I would not recommend this place unless you enjoy over paying for bland mediocre food. I'm giving this establishment a 2 for the great music, decor, & the hostess. 
3 out of 4 of us enjoyed our food. We had the mac & cheese balls appetizers, they were so bland kraft mac & cheese has more flavor.
For dinner, my son ordered the American Soldier, his friend ordered the cat fish, my boyfriend ordered the chicken fried steak, & I ordered the western burger. The burgers looked & smelled great but were so bland & tasteless, not even adding ketchup, salt & pepper could save it or even give it flavor. I think McDonald's is horrible & even then a big Mac has more flavor. The chicken fried steak was also bland & tasteless, where again salt & pepper could not save.
This bar ought to be shut down just for the bad time it provides
Food arrived cold and took a very long time; not very impressed. The best part about this place is the waitresses wearing chaps.

Yes Tobey, I love this bar also. Probably not as much as you since you're the one making money but whatever, I'll contribute to your wealth as long as I have a good time doing it.

Come here pretty much every time I visit Vegas and stay at Harrah's cause I like the proximity and the atmosphere. Best thing about this bar is the menu: Southern Food.

The menu is varied but I get the same thing almost everytime, a fried bologna sandwich, or as I like to call it: Welfare steak. a big ole slice of bologna with fried onions and cheese on toasted bread. Comes with either fries or tater salad. Where I come from, we put mustard in the tater salad but Tobey don't so I'm not crazy about it. It's ok, just not great.

The wife likes to order side dishes like fried okra, pickles, mac n cheese balls, and meatloaf. This time, along with a couple of sides, she ordered the Chicken n Dumplings soup. First time she ordered this and wasn't crazy about it. She said it didn't have enough dumplings in it.

I have no idea why she ordered this. She makes the best chicken n dumplings I ever tasted which is why I never order any anywhere.
